summary:
What this does is take some space from your hard drive and make Windows use it as though it were RAM.


This allows you to play Skyrim for a long time without having to quit after 5-10 mins of playing due to lag. This is generally for people with High-Resolution texture packs, because these really large textures fill up Skyrims RAM and cache REA
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/images/23232-1-1346177576.png[/img][/center]
[center][b]What this does is take some space from your hard drive and make Windows use it as though it were RAM.[/b][/center]


[b]This allows you to play Skyrim for a long time without having to quit after 5-10 mins of playing due to lag. This is generally for people with High-Resolution texture packs, because these really large textures fill up Skyrims RAM and cache REALLY fast![/b]


1. Open start menu, and right click [color=\"#FFFF00\"]My Computer[/color], click [color=\"#FFFF00\"]Properties[/color]

2. From the top left select [color=\"#FFFF00\"]Advanced System Settings[/color]

3. You should be at the [color=\"#FFFF00\"]Advanced[/color] page. Under [color=\"#FFFF00\"]Performance[/color] click [color=\"#FFFF00\"]Settings[/color]

4. In this new window, select the [color=\"#FFFF00\"]Advanced[/color] page

5. Under [color=\"#FFFF00\"]Virtual Memory[/color], select [color=\"#FFFF00\"]Change[/color]

6. There should be a check beside [color=\"#FFFF00\"]\"Automatically Manage Paging File Size....\"[/color] , so [b]UNCHECK[/b] that and select the drive on which your Skyrim is installed [i](Commonly C: drive)[/i]

7. Select [color=\"#FFFF00\"]Custom Size[/color], and the numbers you place in the two boxes are dependent on how much available space you have on your hardrive.  [i][I have a lot of free space so i put [b]1000mb[/b] initial and [b]10000mb[/b] maximum][/i]

8. Click [color=\"#FFFF00\"]Set.[/color] Click [color=\"#FFFF00\"]OK[/color] on all the windows.

[color=\"#00FF00\"]9. Restart your computer and enjoy long hours on Skyrim, without having to restart the game every 5-10 minutes.[/color]


[color=\"#00FFFF\"][b]~Ayhay123[/b][/color]
author: Ayhay123
